001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.cli;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.BitcoinNetwork;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
005import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
006import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcConfig;
007import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.bitcoind.BitcoinConfFile;
008import org.apache.commons.cli.Options;
009import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcException;
010import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.cli.BaseJsonRpcTool;
011
012import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext;
013import java.io.PrintWriter;
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.net.URISyntaxException;
016import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
017import java.time.Duration;
018
019import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcURI.RPCPORT_REGTEST;
020import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcURI.RPCPORT_TESTNET;
021
022/**
023 * An attempt at cloning the {@code bitcoin-cli} tool, but using Java and <b>bitcoinj</b>.
024 * The generic JSON-RPC client in {@code consensusj-jsonrpc-cli} is better-maintained.
025 */
026public class BitcoinCLITool extends BaseJsonRpcTool {
027    public final static String commandName = "cj-bitcoin-cli";
028    private final Options options;
029
030    public BitcoinCLITool() {
031        this.options = new BitcoinRpcCliOptions();
032    }
033
034    @Override
035    public String name() {
036        return commandName;
037    }
038
039    @Override
040    public Options options() {
041        return options;
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * main method for bitcoinj-cli tool.
046     * <p>
047     * See {@link BitcoinRpcCliOptions} for options and <a href="https://bitcoin.org/en/developer-reference#bitcoin-core-apis">Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API</a>
048     * for the methods and parameters. Users can use {@code -?} to get general help or {@code help <command>} to get help
049     * on a specific command.
050     *
051     * @param args options, JSON-RPC method, JSON-RPC parameters
052     */
053    public static void main(String[] args) {
054        BitcoinCLITool command = new BitcoinCLITool();
055        int status = command.run(System.out, System.err, args);
056        System.exit(status);
057    }
058
059    @Override
060    public BitcoinCLICall createCall(PrintWriter out, PrintWriter err, String... args) {
061        return new BitcoinCLICall(this, out, err, args);
062    }
063
064    public static class BitcoinCLICall extends BaseJsonRpcTool.CommonsCLICall {
065        private BitcoinClient client;
066        private final boolean rpcWait;
067
068        public BitcoinCLICall(BitcoinCLITool tool, PrintWriter out, PrintWriter err, String[] args) {
069            super(tool, out, err, args);
070            rpcWait = line.hasOption("rpcwait");
071        }
072
073        @Override
074        public BitcoinClient rpcClient(SSLContext sslContext) {
075            // Not threadsafe
076            // This needs work if there are ever going to be multiple clients calling this method
077            if (client == null) {
078                RpcConfig config = getRPCConfig();
079                client = createClient(sslContext, config);
080                if (rpcWait) {
081                    // TODO: Add logging here to replace the System.out.println
082                    //System.out.println("Connecting to: " + getRPCConfig().getURI() + " with -rpcWait");
083                    boolean available = false;   // Wait up to 1 hour
084                    try {
085                        available = client.waitForServer(Duration.ofMinutes(60));
086                    } catch (JsonRpcException e) {
087                        rpcTool.printError(this, "JSON-RPC Exception: " + e.getMessage());
088                        throw new ToolException(1, e.getMessage());
089                    }
090                    if (!available) {
091                        rpcTool.printError(this,"Timeout error.");
092                        throw new ToolException(1, "Timeout error.");
093                    }
094                }
095            }
096            return client;
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public BitcoinClient rpcClient() {
101            SSLContext sslContext;
102            try {
103                sslContext = SSLContext.getDefault();
104            } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
105                throw new RuntimeException(e);
106            }
107            return rpcClient(sslContext);
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Override this method to customize the client implementation subclass
112         * @param config Configuration information for connecting to server
113         * @return a newly constructed BitcoinClient with specified config
114         */
115        protected BitcoinClient createClient(SSLContext sslContext, RpcConfig config) {
116            return new BitcoinClient( sslContext, config.network(),
117                    config.getURI(),
118                    config.getUsername(),
119                    config.getPassword());
120        }
121
122        public RpcConfig getRPCConfig() {
123            RpcConfig confFileConfig = BitcoinConfFile.readDefaultConfig().getRPCConfig();
124            URI uri = getServerURI(confFileConfig.getURI());
125            String user = line.getOptionValue("rpcuser", confFileConfig.getUsername());
126            String pass = line.getOptionValue("rpcpassword", confFileConfig.getPassword());
127            Network network;
128            if (line.hasOption("regtest")) {
129                network = BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST;
130            } else if (line.hasOption(("testnet"))) {
131                network = BitcoinNetwork.TESTNET;
132            } else {
133                // TODO: Use network params from BitcoinConfFile, before falling back
134                network =BitcoinNetwork.MAINNET;
135            }
136            return new RpcConfig(network, uri, user, pass);
137        }
138
139        private URI getServerURI(URI confFileURI) {
140            String scheme = confFileURI.getScheme();
141            String host = confFileURI.getHost();
142            int port = confFileURI.getPort();
143            String file = confFileURI.getPath();
144
145            if (line.hasOption("rpcssl")) {
146                scheme = "https";
147            }
148            if (line.hasOption("rpcconnect")) {
149                host = line.getOptionValue("rpcconnect", host);
150            }
151            if (line.hasOption("regtest"))  {
152                port = RPCPORT_REGTEST;
153            } else if (line.hasOption("testnet")) {
154                port = RPCPORT_TESTNET;
155            }
156            if (line.hasOption("rpcport")) {
157                String portString = line.getOptionValue("rpcport");
158                port = Integer.parseInt(portString);
159            }
160            URI rpcServerURI = null;
161            try {
162                rpcServerURI = new URI(scheme, null, host, port, file, null, null);
163            } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
164                // We should be careful that this never happens
165                e.printStackTrace();
166                // But if it does, throw an unchecked exception
167                throw new RuntimeException(e);
168            }
169            return rpcServerURI;
170        }
171
172
173    }
174}
